simplesect.para: This is used to define the public handle types for the Azure Kinect APIs. The macro is not intended to be used outside of the Azure Kinect headers.

detaileddescription.para: The buffer for each image is encoded as a JPEG and can be decoded by a JPEG decoder.
Because the image is compressed, the stride parameter for the k4a_image_t is not applicable.
Each MJPG encoded image in a stream may be of differing size depending on the compression efficiency.
NV12 images separate the luminance and chroma data such that all the luminance is at the beginning of the buffer, and the chroma lines follow immediately after.

Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory. Chroma has half as many lines of height and half the width in pixels of the luminance. Each chroma line has the same width in bytes as a luminance line.
YUY2 stores chroma and luminance data in interleaved pixels.
Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.
Each pixel of BGRA32 data is four bytes. The first three bytes represent Blue, Green, and Red data. The fourth byte is the alpha channel and is unused in the Azure Kinect APIs.
Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.
The Azure Kinect device does not natively capture in this format. Requesting images of this format requires additional computation in the API.
Each pixel of DEPTH16 data is two bytes of little endian unsigned depth data. The unit of the data is in millimeters from the origin of the camera.
Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.
Each pixel of IR16 data is two bytes of little endian unsigned depth data. The value of the data represents brightness.
This format represents infrared light and is captured by the depth camera.
Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.
Each pixel of CUSTOM8 is a single channel one byte of unsigned data.
Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.
Each pixel of CUSTOM16 is a single channel two bytes of little endian unsigned data.
Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.
Used in conjunction with user created images or images packing non-standard data.
See the originator of the custom formatted image for information on how to interpret the data.

simplesect.para: The image format indicates how the k4a_image_t buffer data is interpreted.

detaileddescription.para: May be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_AUTO or K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.

The Azure Kinect supports a limited number of fixed expsore settings. When setting this, expect the exposure to be rounded up to the nearest setting. Exceptions are 1) The last value in the table is the upper limit, so a value larger than this will be overridden to the largest entry in the table. 2) The exposure time cannot be larger than the equivelent FPS. So expect 100ms exposure time to be reduced to 30ms or 33.33ms when the camera is started. The most recent copy of the table 'device_exposure_mapping' is in https://github.com/microsoft/Azure-Kinect-Sensor-SDK/blob/develop/src/color/color_priv.h
Exposure time is measured in microseconds.
May only be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.
Value of 0 means framerate priority. Value of 1 means exposure priority.
Using exposure priority may impact the framerate of both the color and depth cameras.
Deprecated starting in 1.2.0. Please discontinue usage, firmware does not support this.
May only be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.
The valid range is 0 to 255. The default value is 128.
May only be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.
May only be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.
May only be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.
May be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_AUTO or K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.
The unit is degrees Kelvin. The setting must be set to a value evenly divisible by 10 degrees.
May only be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.
Value of 0 means backlight compensation is disabled. Value of 1 means backlight compensation is enabled.
May only be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.
May only be set to K4A_COLOR_CONTROL_MODE_MANUAL.
Value of 1 sets the powerline compensation to 50 Hz. Value of 2 sets the powerline compensation to 60 Hz.

simplesect.para: The current settings can be read with k4a_device_get_color_control(). The settings can be set with k4a_device_set_color_control().
Control values set on a device are reset only when the device is power cycled. The device will retain the settings even if the k4a_device_t is closed or the application is restarted.

briefdescription.para: set the associated k4a_color_control_command_t to auto
set the associated k4a_color_control_command_t to manual

simplesect.para: The current settings can be read with k4a_device_get_color_control(). The settings can be set with k4a_device_set_color_control().

briefdescription.para: Neither 'Sync In' or 'Sync Out' connections are used.
The 'Sync Out' jack is enabled and synchronization data it driven out the connected wire.

detaileddescription.para: While in master mode the color camera must be enabled as part of the multi device sync signalling logic. Even if the color image is not needed, the color camera must be running.

briefdescription.para: The 'Sync In' jack is used for synchronization and 'Sync Out' is driven for the next device in the chain.

detaileddescription.para: 'Sync Out' is a mirror of 'Sync In' for this mode.

briefdescription.para: Synchronization mode when connecting two or more devices together.
Number of types excluding unknown type.

detaileddescription.para: Specifies a type of calibration.
Calibration model is Theta (arctan).
Calibration model is Polynomial 3K.
Calibration model is Rational 6KT.

briefdescription.para: Calibration model is Brown Conrady (compatible with OpenCV)

detaileddescription.para: The model used interpret the calibration parameters.

simplesect.para: Azure Kinect devices are calibrated with Brown Conrady.
k4a_device_info_t to store whether a device has a color camera, a depth camera and IMU.

memberdef.definition: typedef void() k4a_logging_message_cb_t(void *context, k4a_log_level_t level, const char *file, const int line, const char *message)
memberdef.argsstring: (void *context, k4a_log_level_t level, const char *file, const int line, const char *message)
memberdef.name: k4a_logging_message_cb_t

briefdescription.para: Callback function for debug messages being generated by the Azure Kinect SDK.

parameterdescription.para: The context of the callback function. This is the context that was supplied by the caller to k4a_set_debug_message_handler.
The level of the message that has been created.
The file name of the source file that generated the message.
The line number of the source file that generated the message.
The messaged generated by the Azure Kinect SDK.

simplesect.para: The callback is called asynchronously when the Azure Kinext SDK generates a message at a level that is equal to or more critical than the level specified when calling k4a_set_debug_message_handler() to register the callback.

This callback can occur from any thread and blocks the calling thread. The k4a_logging_message_cb_t function user must protect it's logging resources from concurrent calls. All care should be made to minimize the amount of time locks are held.

briefdescription.para: Callback function for a memory object being destroyed.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer pointer that was supplied by the caller as buffer_release_cb to k4a_image_create_from_buffer().
The context for the memory object that needs to be destroyed that was supplied by the caller as buffer_release_cb_context to k4a_image_create_from_buffer().

simplesect.para: When all references for the memory object are released, this callback will be invoked as the final destroy for the given memory.

briefdescription.para: Callback function for a memory allocation.

parameterdescription.para: Minimum size in bytes needed for the buffer.
Output parameter for a context that will be provided in the subsequent call to the k4a_memory_destroy_cb_t callback.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the newly allocated memory.
A callback of this type is provided when there is an application defined allocator.

briefdescription.para: Initial configuration setting for disabling all sensors.

simplesect.para: Use this setting to initialize a k4a_device_configuration_t to a disabled state.
